step1.sentence: When the storm hit the town, neighbors pulled together to help each other clear the damage.

step2.story: The event was a complete mess until the entire volunteer team decided to pull together and divide the work clearly. Within an hour, the chaos had turned into something that actually looked organized.

step3.story: The school soccer team had lost four games in a row and morale was low. At practice on Wednesday, the coach said nothing about tactics. Instead, he asked everyone to sit in a circle and talk honestly about what was going wrong. The players pulled together, addressed their issues directly, and came back the following weekend to win by three goals.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 어려운 상황에서 모두가 힘을 모아 함께 노력하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 위기나 어려운 상황에서 사람들이 협력하고 단결할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: pull(당기다, 힘쓰다)과 together(함께)가 결합하여 모두가 같은 방향으로 함께 힘을 쓴다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 특히 위기나 어려운 상황에서의 협력을 강조합니다. 단순한 팀워크보다 더 절박하고 단결된 느낌을 줍니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The whole community pulled together to support the families affected by the flood.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 지역 사회 전체가 홍수 피해 가족들을 돕기 위해 힘을 모았어요.
